title: Benjamin Franklin's Kite
description: A micro-lesson that makes Benjamin Franklin's Kite usable.

hook.text: In 1752, Benjamin Franklin flew a kite in a thunderstorm to prove lightning is electrical.

buildup.text: He tied a metal key to the kite string and waited for a storm to approach.

twist.text: Others who tried this experiment were killed. Franklin was either brilliant or very, very lucky.

punchline.text: Franklin proved lightning is electricity with a kite and a key. Others who tried it died.
